And the way the Grinch is in this movie is totally wrong. He bearly moves, he just walks and sometimes uses his arms. Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Oh man, new age kids films are so squeaky clean and completely airy fairy. Older "kids" films were totally family oriented and had plenty of Easter eggs which went over the kids heads but the parents could laugh at them or the kids would come back one day as adults and laugh at this joke they completely missed when they were little. 

Also, anyone else notice how predictable the jokes are in these new age kids films too? This is feels like it's the trailer for every other new age kids film. Pop music, music stop, somebody gets hurt 'it's funny', something cute, something completely random happens it's 'funny'. It's like a blueprint kids film trailer, just change characters and situations and the pop music a bit and here you have the advertisement for another kids film. 

Totally bleugh and meh. What's with grinchs voice too ?? He sounds like a normal man... 

But this is a kids movie, nothing matters, its not that deep...

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
I feel that this movie was loyal to the book and the original 1966 animated version! They didn't change who the character's were and they didn't change the main plot of the story. Instead, they added more characters to contribute to the good story telling, a proper motivation for not only the grinch, but for the other characters as well, and an entire road of character development! It all made sence! We didn't have an unnecessary love story and we most certainly did not have bad behaving whos and sex jokes. The Grinch was decent, not gross and evil. You can argue that Ted Geisel's Grinch is supposed to be evil, but looking back, The original grinch didn't even interact with the whos! He just hated all the noise they would make. He didn't burn down trees or eat glass. Sure he did abuse his dog, but after his heart grew three sizes bigger, he actually treated his dog fairly! We could see this is the two other books Dr.Seuss wrote tittled "I am Max" and "I am Cindy Lou who". They happen right after Christmas. Some are mad that they took the abusive aspect away from him, but hey! If Jim Carrey's movie could change and rearrange everything then I'm pretty sure this shouldn't bother most people. I must say the interaction between the Grinch and the animals in this film were quite fun to watch!

 In all honesty, Dr.Seuss made one dimensional character's who were only meant to convey a message. Of course I'm not saying Jim Carrey's is bad or you should not like it, but if we are going to start comparing carrey's to Cumberbatch's grinch then we need to set the two beside each other. This movie made sence while the other didn't. 

The atmosphere, animation and music we see in this film is simply candy to one's ears and eyes and the comedy was actually funny! This may be the same studio who cursed us with fart jokes in every one of their films like the minions or Sing, but for once it seemed like they actually cared about the quality of their movie! Now that alone deserves to be appreciated. 

My only conclusion as to why people didn't enjoy this grinch so much is because it was mostly directed towards a younger audience. It was soft. It didn't have that spark of weirdness. Jim Carrey's had adult jokes and creepy acting which the older audiences enjoyed a lot (12 and up)! It explains why most people found it boring, but bashing on it endlessy for being more decent is unacceptable. It ruins everyone's fun. 

I enjoyed this Grinch a lot. It has so much for us to breathe in, yet it's still loyal to Ted Geisel's book and animated short. It's perfect.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
This movie is a total disappointment. Trash. Trash. Trash. Worst: recycled trash. Disney no longer respects its viewers, let alone the source material. 

Don‚Äôt go see it. Stream it illegally if you want. Either way, It‚Äôs a waste of time and money. I can promise you that in one year‚Äôs time, you will be seeing the 2000 version over this. 

The characters are one dimensional and the same as every other Disney film. 

Cindy Low Who? You mean the annoying Despicable Me girl whose kink is a Fluffy Pony‚Äîponytail and all. The Grinch? You mean Mr. ‚ÄúI lost my family, I am an orphan, was a good guy but loneliness made me sad and now I hate everyone and especially Christmas‚Äù. No! No! No! 

The Grinch‚Äôs redemption in the original story had a huge impact because he was mean, not because he was a broken soul who needed the unconditional love from a little girl. Disney neutered the Grinch!! In this story, the Grinch had no balls to be mean. All the evil we ever get from him is in the trailer. Talk about spoiler alert!!! 

The Moose? You might be wondering what I am talking about. You get my point. 

The Mom and the festive guy who says he is the Grinch‚Äôs best friend. Did any of you get trailer trash and stereotypical black guy vibes? 

Max. He was good hearted in the original; he is good hearted here. This is the only redeemable quality.

The gang of kids. Unnecessary. 

You have been warned, Merry Christmas.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
The original Grinch was evil, even compared to the Jim Carrie version. They lightened him up here to match the times where you can't have that kind of thing anymore. I'm sure it's a good movie but softening up the character takes away certain elements that the original animated story had.¬†
This is really a touch of Grinch with grumpy and mildly mean.  The Grinch had pure hatred in his heart which is what made his transition to good at the end so powerful. But maybe they think that would be a bad influence on our delicate youth.

Comment: This movie was bad, really bad. I had to watch it thanks to my classmates on a field trip and may I say I regretted wasting all my money on a piece of garbo like this. I'm not trying to be a hater or comparing it to the classic (and best one in my opinion)The grinch played by Jim Carrey,  but this movie actually infuriated me. Nothing like the original cartoon; nothing scary or mean about him. Just a washed out "cute" version of Grinch that apparently lives on a good house, eats fancy ass food and can go around Who ville without anyone giving a shit. Nothing about the movie is funny, has too many overly used jokes, unnecessary scenes, boring plot, little character development and trash soundtrack. I would rather have relations with donkey Kong or  snort cocaine before watching this lame shit again

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment: I know the Jim Carrey film is a favorite to younger people, but I thought it was a mess. I was raised on the original animated TV special and still love it! I'm actually in favor of a new animated film, but this doesn't look right. The Grinch looks too cute, and his voice does not sound like a crotchety old man, it sounds like a 20-year-old. Also, we don't need modern pop culture references like that stupid "Happy" song - The Grinch is a timeless story and shouldn't date itself. Lastly, what the hell was that figure skating thing all about? Ugh. Well, if today's kids enjoy it, good for them.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Ok this movie hasn‚Äôt even been released yet and I have 3 problems here.

Problem 1. The jokes aren‚Äôt funny just stupid. Come on Illumination. You guys wrote the Despicable Me movies. You can be funny. These movies are proof of that.

Problem 2. It‚Äôs totally dated with the music and stupid humor. One of the reasons the first movie was such a classic is how timeless it was. If I didn‚Äôt know it was from 1966 I would‚Äôve guessed 50s 70s or maybe even the 80s. It could‚Äôve taken place in a number of decades. With this, it screams 2010s. If we looked back at this in 20 or 30 years, we would be able to tell it‚Äôs from the 2010s. Being dated doesn‚Äôt do any justice to adapt the original book, nor match up to the first movie.

Problem 3. This movie has no reason to exist. We already have 2 movies of this. One was perfect and the other was........not so perfect. What‚Äôs the point of making another one when we already have an animated movie that‚Äôs perfectly fine? I feel like it‚Äôs only being made just to have a CGI version. It‚Äôs The Lorax all over again. And we all know how well that turned out. It won‚Äôt be different here.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Why remakeing The Grinch is a bad idea:

1) You can't live up to the original-

Sorry, you just can't. Regardless of how good the movie turns out people will compare it to the original and unless this remake is literally the best movie in the world, people will hate it.

2) remakes are typically bad quality-

Those Disney movie remakes -  tolerated. Ghostbusters remake - bad. Who could forget the 2000 Grinch remake? - Very VERY bad. Not all remakes are bad, but come on, but there is an undeniable trend.

3) No one wanted it 
Seriously, if you think there was a large majority of people saying "oh the original Grinch was good, but what I REALLY want is a remake" then you are sorely mistaken. The only reason people watch half of these silly movies is because they recognize the characters. Look at the Emoji Movie, it relied on people just knowing what an emoji is and it ... Netted $25.65 million on its opening weekend?...

...Whelp looks like I'm wrong. If the Emoji Movie can net $25.65 million on its opening weekend then anything can happen. Don't mind me, I'm just going to find a very high cliff to jump off of...

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
One more rant. Using Happy as the joke song  completely shows that they have no idea the point of that song itself. It's about being okay in hard times, not a mildless it's a small world smile on my face type song.
His hide out is so clean. He's also genuinely just a mean person who's selfish. The Grinch was either born being miserable and depressed or in the live action one at least they tried to give a reason he was that way. 
The Grinch also never came down to town. Not that I'm saying people shouldn't experiment with different takes, but this particular one kinda defeats whom the Grinch is. He genuinely hates the who's, he wants them all to be sad and miserable as he is. Being a troll in their town is not that.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Can Illumination just die as a company? And can all the talented and people who care about their craft be sent over to Disney and Pixar? All three movies they proudly mention are fucking awful.

Seriously, even though I enjoyed Sing as mindless entertainment, I know it's garbage and good god Secret Life of Pets is up their with The good Dinosaur as a bomb fest. I was so angry when I found out all the good and funny scenes were in the trailer. Nice bait.

Did you know that the late Dr. Seusses  wife found The Cat in the Hat with Michael Meyers to be so appaling that she banned any future live action films? Hollywood got around this by making them all CGI.

The Grinch got very mixed reviews (I personally like that movie, because even with the adult humor, the original point was still there even with the added idea of saying the towns people were greedy and the speech about averice.) Not a great movie, but CITH made me angry. The violent humor where he cuts off his tale, the overtly raunchy humor of oogling over the mom just ... no.

The lorax is a joke. Only reason the boy cared was to get in the pants of a girl old enough to be his baby sitter. And in the end, the trees were yet another commodity to oogle at. There was no intrinsic understanding of what the Oncler did and the possibility that maybe the tree in the last seed might never grow.
Also the towns people were fine. There was no proverty and no one who could not afford clean air. So there was no actual conflict or reason to need trees. They were just pretty and they wanted them because they were rare.

Comment:
All the people who are like "ThIS iS gOnNa rUiN tHE OrIgINaL YoU cAnT BEaT The oRiGiNAaAll" Have me confused? How is it gonna ruin it?? Like its a "remake" sure, but how can this movie ruin the original? It only gets ruined if YOU ruin it for yourself.. It doesn't make sense when people say stuff like that..
Like no, its not the newer versions that ruin the older ones, its people letting their views be skewed because??? They choose to let something else change their opinion instead of just enjoying what they like no matter what comes afterwards.. I get that people have their opinions but like... it just seems so weird how peoples views on stuff can change so drastically because a company decides to make something new. Smh

Anyway, this doesn't look to bad to me, like.. People say its random but?? Like thats kind of how these movies are anyway... looking back at older movies, some of those were wildly random and weird, but people still liked them..I guess its because its "new" and looks more modern? But i just honestly see this as its own thing, and not really relating it to other stuff. I really like the look and feel of this, i admit the minions and the song "Happy" kind of... Are a little... Eh? To me? But i still enjoy this for what it is.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
This film raises the very important question...    WHY?

The story, and redemption, has been told in animation, with one totally unnecessary live action film remake.  The story made clear that the Grinch was completely anti-social until AFTER his redemption.  So, if this is a "prequel", it makes no sense for him to be interacting with Whoville or its residents in ANY form (other than spying through his telescope).  And, if it's a sequel,  it COMPLETELY makes no sense, as the Grinch had been redeemed.

Oh, but we have all these computers to use (spitting in the eye of all the talented animators that produced the TIMELESS original...

It's Benedict Cumberbatch, so, is Mindy Lou going to yell, "GRIIIIIIINNNNNNCH!" at the camera?

Fuck you, Universal...

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment: I grew up being frightened every time I'd see Jim Carrey's Grinch, but that made it memorable to me. Because he played this character so well, I thought no person could be so cunning and hateful during Christmas, so the 6 years-old me sincerely saw him as a real, hateful being. Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
He's at a grocery store and the town just ignores him... In the story they know the grinch and they hate the grinch.. If they saw him in real life they'd most likely cower in fear.. He's supposed to be a hard ass with no feeling other than hate in his body until Betty Lou Who makes him feel. Therefore, he would have no desire to 'love' figure skating or even want to do it, he wouldn't let Max on the chair because he has no feelings for Max other than him being his slave like creature, and finally he shouldn't be smiling at things that aren't diabolical until the end when he has a change of heart and smiles for the good. Illumination Studios is a company that prides itself in milking money out of films they know people will see while putting the least amount of work into their films. The animation is awful, based on the scenes they chose to use for the TRAILER you know the story line has got to be the dumbest thing on the face of the planet, and it's clear by the trailer that the writers have no comprehension of who the Grinch is as a character. 

This was just supposed to be a one liner comment but then I just kept going and going.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment: The Grinch did many mean things, but for a reason: to stop Christmas. In the trailer he's just mean for the sake of being mean. That's not a character arc, it's a script writer masturbating. The visuals are awesome, I don't even mind not having Boris Karloff for the voice - Cumberbatch is a fantastic choice - but once again we get a character written by people to lazy to understand the source material. It can't be a worse movie than the Carrey version, but it will still be wrong.

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
*sighs* I really REALLY had high hopes for this despite the previous modern dr Seuss renditions and the reputation they carry. However, this really dashes them. I will take a moment to compliment the design here...it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful, and captures the Suess style very well. 
I really thought Cumberbatch was the perfect cast, and I still do...but he doesn‚Äôt do it as i thought..he brings up the voice s little too high imo..if he played it a little closer to how he does Sherlock it‚Äôd be better. 
The trailer just looks bland and uninteresting in terms of content..I‚Äôm starting to think Dr Suess should never be made into feature length films (to avoid needless padding) and just stick with shorts, if anything. 

To anyone suggesting that the jim carry movie is good..what is wrong with you üòÇ

Comment:
ok, so whats something good i can say about this......
1.  the animation and style is ok.  It looks very Dr. Seussy....

but the bad:
1. benedict is already wrong for this
2.  the waking up throwing something at the alarm clock gag- so overDONE.
3.  his khan closed mouth laugh was cringe
4.  this is called the grinch and the dog is the only thing we care about
5.  random violence- really a snowman floaty punching him?  who thought that'd be funny?
6.  the grinch going around the store eating food in the aisles and then spitting it out
7. making the grinch an aspiring figure skater-WTF?  This was the best writers could think of to be funny or ironic?
8.  the figure skating scene didn't eve make sense- it felt like a short film sequence that went nowhere
9.  the happy song is way too obvious for a grinch movie-WAY TOO on the nose-lazy marketers
10.  watching live action television in a cartoon world?  that's a no.

ALSO!!  WHAT IS IT WITH ILLUMINATION STUDIOS AND MAKING COMEDY AND FAMILY FRIENDLY MOVIES OUT OF SUCH HEARTLESS SELFISH CHARACTERS?

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Okay, Dr. Seuss's Grinch has always been a sort of fairy-tale telling of the story of Grendel, with a twist for a happy ending.
 ((Guy lives on a mountain, he's got neighbors in the valley that are too loud, he goes down and busts up their stuff.)) 
And as a Christian bonus it was because of the Christmas spirit.
But this feels more like they're following a cue from John Gardner.
I honestly don't know which author should get more credit. Obviously Seuss came first in '57, then Gardner in '71, but which story is going to show?

Title: THE GRINCH Official Trailer (2018)
Comment:
Eh...  The Jim Carrey movie wasn't that good anyway, and even for someone like me who is not a fan of Illumination, this definitely looks like an improvement over that film.

But my biggest question is, why do Dr. Seuss' books constantly get made into movies when the original books and TV specials don't need fixing.  Not everything was a classic, but they all had great levels of passion and surprisingly complex and universal morals.  All the movies do is just take all of that away and just replace with every family movie cliche meant to appeal to the lowest common denominator (like adding rap songs or Captain Planet straw man villains in The Lorax, or anime references in Horton, or all the needless and painful adult jokes in The Cat of the The Grinch

If you like any of the Dr. Seuss movies and/or are excited to see this one (or not, because just like The Mummy where people will constantly think of the Brendan Fraser one as the original due to the Tom Cruise movie, people will constantly think the Jim Carrey Grinch is the original instead of the Chuck Jones cartoon), that's absolutely fine with me, everyone gets excited over different things.  Just don't consider me part of that chorus of people.  I could be wrong and the movie could totally catch me off guard and actually be good, but I'm not holding out hope.
